intro: [WRONG START] Lathyrus clymenep subvar. latifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved sweet pea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and the plant produces elongated, cylindrical pods containing lens-shaped seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
